step1.sentence: After months of practice, she finally managed to overcome a weakness in her public speaking skills.

step2.story: Jake had always struggled with time management, constantly missing deadlines at work. Determined to change, he started using a strict scheduling system and asked his mentor for accountability check-ins. Within three months, he had overcome a weakness that had held him back for years.

step3.story: Mina was a talented software engineer, but her fear of presenting in front of others was becoming a serious problem. Every team demo left her voice shaking and her slides rushed. One day, her manager pulled her aside and said she needed to overcome a weakness if she wanted to lead the next project. Mina signed up for a weekly speaking club and practiced in front of a mirror every night. The first few sessions were painful, but gradually her confidence grew. By the time the product launch arrived, she delivered a flawless presentation that earned a standing ovation from the entire department.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 약점을 극복하다, 즉 자신의 부족한 부분을 이겨내다라는 뜻입니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 자기 계발이나 성장 맥락에서 자주 쓰이며, 단순히 약점을 숨기는 것이 아니라 노력을 통해 실제로 개선하거나 이겨낸다는 의미로 사용됩니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: overcome은 고대 영어 ofercuman(이기다, 정복하다)에서 유래했으며, weakness는 weak(약한)에 접미사 -ness가 붙어 약한 상태를 나타냅니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순히 '고치다(fix)'보다 더 적극적이고 도전적인 뉘앙스를 가지며, 상당한 노력과 의지가 수반되었음을 암시합니다. 격식체와 일상 대화 모두에서 자연스럽게 쓰입니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: He worked hard to overcome a weakness in math before the final exam.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그는 기말고사 전에 수학의 약점을 극복하기 위해 열심히 공부했다.
